meanings.definition: To waste (money, time, resources) recklessly or foolishly.
meanings.sent1: She squandered all her savings on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent2: He squandered his inheritance on luxury cars and vacations.
meanings.sent3: The character in the story squandered his chance to win the race by stopping to tie his shoe.
meanings.sent4: The team squandered their lead in the final minutes of the game.
meanings.sent5: The student squandered his study time playing video games, leading to poor grades.

meanings.sent1: The wealthy heiress squandered her fortune on designer clothes and expensive jewelry.
meanings.sent2: He squandered his bonus on a lavish party for his friends.
meanings.sent3: The king squandered the kingdom's treasury on elaborate banquets and unnecessary wars.
meanings.sent4: She squandered her talent by never practicing or honing her skills.
meanings.sent5: The company squandered its profits on unnecessary office renovations instead of investing in growth.

meanings.definition: To fail to take advantage of an opportunity.
meanings.sent1: He squandered the chance to learn a new skill by procrastinating.
meanings.sent2: She squandered the opportunity to travel the world by staying home and watching TV.
meanings.sent3: The student squandered the extra credit assignment by forgetting to turn it in on time.
meanings.sent4: The entrepreneur squandered the potential partnership by not following up with the interested investor.
meanings.sent5: The team squandered the lead in the competition by underestimating their opponents and not giving their best effort.
